clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Vitamin D3 Supplementation With Conventional Synthetic Disease Modifying Antirheumatic Drugs(csDMARD) in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Vitamin D3 Supplementation With Conventional Synthetic Disease Modifying Antirheumatic Drugs (csDMARD) in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients: Randomized Double-blind Placebo Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujib Medical University, Dhaka, Bangladesh

clinical_study.source: Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujib Medical University, Dhaka, Bangladesh

brief_summary.textblock: Several studies suggested low serum level of vitamin D have been associated with rheumatoid arthritis. So, the present study is designed to investigate the role of vitamin D supplementation along with CsDMARD in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.

detailed_description.textblock:
Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) is a autoimmune arthritis characterised by synovitis of peripheral joints, with extra-articular manifestations with a prevalence of 0.5 - 1%.
The incidence of RA is appeared during last decade followed a 4-decade period of time during which the incidence declined, and it appeared to be limited to women. The treatment of this condition remain unsatisfactory with a good response to conventional medications. Some recent trial attempted to asses the effect of vitamin D3 supplementation to improve patient's pain and disease activity and most of them shows positive findings. This proposed study is an effort whether there is any role of vitamin D3 as a supplement with conventional synthetic DMARDs( csDMARD) to produce improvement of pain symptoms and disease activity in RA patients. This study will be a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial will be conducted in the department of Pharmacology, BSMMU in collaboration with the Rheumatology Rehabilitation Clinic of department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, BSMMU from the day of approval by the Institutional Review Board(IRB) to January, 2022. Validated version of visual analogue scale (VAS) and Disease Activity Score-28 C reactive protein (DAS-28 CRP) scale will be used to asses patients. A total of 90 patients suffering from RA will be selected according to inclusion and exclusion criteria and serum vitamin D and C Reactive Protein(CRP) level will be assessed. The clinical diagnosis of patients suffering from RA would be performed by a physiatrist at the Rheumatology Rehabilitation Clinic of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation department. After completing the necessary formalities including informed consent of the patients, patient would undergo a selected questionnaire disease activity score (DAS-28) to assess the disease activity and visual analogue scale (VAS) to asses pain improvement. The patients would be randomly allocated into two arms: intervention and control arm. Patient in intervention arm would consist of patients who will receive conventional DMARDs plus vitamin D for 8 weeks. Intervention arm will receive vitamin D (40,000IU) weekly orally. On the other hand, patient in control arm will receive placebo for 8 weeks starting after the day of initial assessment . Blood sample will be collected to measure serum vitamin D and C Reactive Protein(CRP) level at baseline and again after 8 weeks of therapeutic intervention. The regularity of medicine intake will be ensured over telephone, pill count, and from the patient's compliance sheet. Statistical analysis will be obtained by SPSS (statistical package for social science) version 24. Unpaired 't' test will be done to compare between two means of interventional group and placebo group. Paired 't' test will be done to compare between two means of before and after intervention. Proportion test 'Z' will be done to compare proportion between intervention group and placebo group. Calculated 'p' value may suggest the level of significance ( significant at p < 0.05). After approval from Institutional Review Board (IRB) every eligible patient will be informed about the intervention and the study objectives. Patient will also be informed that participants can participate in this study by participants free will and also participants are free to refuse to participate or to withdraw at any time without compromising participants medical care. Patients who will take part in the study willingly with written consent will be interviewed. Patient's confidentiality will be strictly maintained. Patients personal data regarding name, age, sex and other information will not be disclosed anywhere and will only be used for research purpose. The study will help to analyze whether vitamin D3 supplementation has any role to reduce pain symptoms and disease activity.

primary_outcome.description: Changes in severity of pain will be measured through the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) at baseline and at 8 weeks, minimum value 0 and maximum value 10, higher score mean a worse outcome.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who met 2010 ACR/EULAR criteria for Rheumatoid arthritis
- Age: 18 years or above
- Both gender
Exclusion Criteria:
- Overlapped syndrome
- Patients with renal and liver disease, malabsorption, hyperparathyroidism
- Spondyloarthritis, psoriatic arthritis, Systemic lupus erythematosus
- Patients receiving vitamin D3, anti TB like rifampicin, isoniazid, anti-seizure drugs within last two months
- Patients unwilling to participate or unwilling to give written consent
- Pregnant & lactating woman
- Impaired cognitive function
